Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Makram B
Reviews.Content: Easter vacation was great in Istanbul, especially where I stayed helped a lot. Five Boutique Hotel is great for nice and warm stay. Where the staff is always ready to help. I liked it a lot because the price was excellent for what we had in this hotel, silence at night, clean, cozy, a small view to Istanbul, away from crowds. Also near Taksim (20 min walk),or 4 min walk to Osmanbey metro station, where you can go to Taksim in the next stop. Overall the hotel is nice price vs. stay. Excellent internet connection, and you are always asked for the service. And the manager is an excellent helping man and ready to hear any comments, Mr. Yasar Cetin. Thank you for the stay and hope to see you soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Penny M M
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel on an unassuming street close enough to Taksim Sq but away from the hustle and bustle. First things first- Staff were friendly and helpful but unobtrusive. Organic boutique? We weren't really bothered about the organic side of things, we just wanted a reasonably priced, non-shabby place to stay. We were in Istanbul to see the sights, not to spend day and night inside. Having said this, it RAINED LIKE HELL when we were there and there were some days when we just stayed in bed..and it was LOVELY. I would recommend that you take one of the top rooms because you can pop on the balcony and see over the city. I shared a topfloor room with my friend and our other companion had the adjacent room so we could amble between the two - it was like our own mini apartmen and felt very private (I think they call this the family floor?). Larger room had a kingsized bed, both rooms very clean and pretty sleek in decor. (I cannot vouch for other rooms in the hotel because we didnt see them). Bathrooms were nice (Spotless, good shower, bath, organic toiletries) The rainy days we spent in very comfy bed watching telly and drinking tea. Totally relaxing. The breakfast (in the cafe downstairs) was traditional cold foods set out on tables like a small buffet (Muesli, natural yogurt, honey, dried fruit, fresh fruit, cheeses, meat, bread etc). You can request cooked food such as eggs which they'll prepare as you wish. There is a small TV to catch up on the news (I noticed that when we went down to breakfast, the staff would change the channel to BBC for us, much to the dismay of the Germans already sat there) The one negative thing I would say is that the lift smells a bit sewage-y - I'm guessing they cant do anything about this, it must be the position of the liftshaft. Anyway, it's no big deal. Other than that, I dont really have a bad word to say about this place :)

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlo86
Reviews.Content: if you want a little ,nice, romantic and not expensive hotel in center of the Istanbul this is a great hotel. it is clean ,it is friendly ,it is beautiful. we were for new years eve ,and city was crowded ,but hotel was our oasis of peace I highly recommend this hotel. We were coming on sabiha airport ,on that airport you will see hotel information shuttle bus. They will drop you for 10 Euros per person directly to the airport and they can also pick u up, but 5 min from hotel is a bus station so we took HAVAS bus which is 12 TL till airport per person, amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kateb4486
Reviews.Content: Great service, central location, staff were only too happy to help us, so friendly would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting cheaper but nice accomodation in Istanbul. Yesar and Huseyin were great company, Muhammet and Umut very professional!

Reviews.Title: “An ok place...”
Reviews.Author: Nlis O
Reviews.Content: Good: -The staff is very nice. -The very good breakfast is diverse and all organic. -I had a room in the 5th floor on the north side. Though, the walls are thin, I hab no troubles with noise. -The view is ok, but could be better if there wasn't a fire ladder going across the window. -Good wireless connection with 2000 kbps down and 650 kbps up. Not so good: -The cleanlyness I didn't find very impressive. The toilet seat wasn't very well cleaned when I got the room. The next day I found the seat in the same condition. Then I wrote the cleaning staff a note about the situation. The next day the note was gone, but the toilet seat was still disatisfying. -The TV did not have a very good receiption due to a lose contact of the antenna cable. -The shower holder was wonky. -On the hotel website they advertise a free airport shuttle. I asked for that, but reasoning that I did not book directly on their website, they wanted to charge me for this service (30â‚¬ one way. Now I heard not far from here, just before Taksim, is a bus service, which does it for 12TL, which is about 5â‚¬). -The room was spacious but not overly exciting. Conclusion: Due to the lack of attention that is given to some details, next time I might try out a different place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience that i have had in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Adesseda
Reviews.Content: Five boutique hotel was my Worst experience in terms of service (picked us up from the airport 1 hr late), rooms And cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Carrieland
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little hotel. The rooms are small but they are clean and comfortable. It is about a 10 minute walk from all of the major transit hubs in Taksim which can get you to the major tourist destinations and from Beyoglu where there are great restaurants and bars. This is a great hotel if you like to be in a convenient location but not in the middle of the tourist craziness. I am the type of traveler who likes to stay away from the tourist center and be with the locals. The staff were very friendly and helpful with all of our questions. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above "Very Good"”
Reviews.Author: Marcopolo_gr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in fact a lovely medium to experience Istanbul in a cheap (compared to other hotels around) and clean way! I traveled for business purposes, i didn't unfortunately do much of a tourism but if i had the time Five Boutique would be a good choice. The facts: a. It is located almost a kilometer from taksim square (easily walkable, about 10' - 15'). b. It is cheap. c. It is clean. d. The breakfast is more than enough and i found it very tasty. e. The towels are changed every day. f. The stuff is always willing to help. If i must say something negative that would be a bad odour in the elevator (not able to change my overall positive impression about the hotel) If i'll visit again Istanbul i will most probably staying again there.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessJelly1975
Reviews.Content: We found that this hotel is close enough to the hustle and bustle of Taksim Square, but far enough away that it is peaceful. I had a single room, which had a single bed, a work area and a shower room. It was plenty big enough for me, and looked recently decorated and furnished. It did not have a view (unless you count a fire escape!), but to be honest it was pretty much always dark when I was in the room anyway. The reception staff are great, Mustofa was there for most of our trip and he could not have been more helpful. He arranged taxis, a trip to a haman and suggested places to go including the restaurants under Galata Bridge. If I am ever lucky enough to go back to Istanbul, I will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice find”
Reviews.Author: WexfordCarlow
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel on a little side street. staff very helpful and personable and always attentive. had family room which was spotless and comfortable and good size for 3 of us good location away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist area but not too far to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service from YaÅŸar, Mustafa and the team!!”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: FÄ±ve boutÄ±que Ä±s a qualÄ±ty lÄ±ttle hotel sÄ±tuated about 10mÄ±ns walk from TaksÄ±m Sq. When we arrÄ±ved Mustafa, the receptÄ±onÄ±st, was only too happy to share hÄ±s knowledge of Istanbul...publÄ±c transport, sÄ±ghts and thÄ±ngs to see. It was a very helpful Ä±ntroductÄ±on and saved us tÄ±me and money. The staff are only too happy to help out Ä±n anyway they can. Very nÄ±ce. The rooms are above average and we wÄ±ll be happy to come back here Ä±n the future.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, very well situated”
Reviews.Author: Anja F
Reviews.Content: This boutique Hotel (19 rooms) is very well located at 100 m of the Lutfi Kirdar Istanbul conference center and about 5 minutes walk from Taksim square. It is an excellent value, with nice rooms, a delicious breakfast and a very friendly staff. The frontdesk staff and manager are very professional and helpfull. An excellent choice for people attending a conference in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Place that is worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: LiberecKabs
Reviews.Content: Very suitable location for visitors of ICEC/ICC congress centres, some 5 minutes walk. Close to Taksim area / about 10 min walk/. Easy to get to the tourist places. I have asked the staff of the hotel to pick me up at the airport, it was organized very well. The hotel is very clean and quiet, even it is few meters from the rush road. Nice breakfast you can find every morning. If it would appear some troubles, the staff is very friendly and helpful. For people who donÂ´t like huge steril impersonal hotels, this place that is worth to stay..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel! Extremely good location and good value. Staff very friendly and most helpful!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessAlexandra
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by my travel agent. The location is very good, close to Taksim Square. Upon arrival, the hotel manager and staff were very polite and helpful.The rooms are brand new and clean. The organic orientation of the hotel adds a special touch to the whole experience. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Disappointment !!”
Reviews.Author: Wael1968
Reviews.Content: It is some kind of long review but it worth reading for anyone think of booking at â€œFive Boutique Hotelâ€� Istanbul was the last destination of my vacation after Rome, Venice, Munich and Salzburg. I booked Connected 2 Family Rooms for five nights at â€œFive Boutique Hotelâ€� and what a disappointment !!!! - Upon arrival to the hotel on Thursday July 21st we have been greeted by the front office manager and he told me that he have one small problem that one of my two rooms are not ready as the leady who was staying at the room will not leave until midnight. After some argument and convincing him that I booked the rooms from the mid of April (thatâ€™s 3 months before), he went and talk to the lady and convinced her to move to another room. - After waiting for around 30 minutes for the room to be ready, the front office manager came again and told that he has another small problem that the AC in one of the rooms is not working and they faced some technical problem and it will be solved by tomorrow, you can imagine the situation with 3 kids tired and hungry, and after a long discussion, arguments and promises that the hotel is fully booked and this is a temporary situation and the AC will be fixed by tomorrow. I agreed to check in and put the luggage in the larger room (the one with no AC) and me, my wife and the three kids spend the night in the smaller room, two of us slept on the bed, one on the sofa bed and the other two we put blankets and slept on the floor. - Our two rooms was on the 7th floor and the tiny elevator goes only to the fifth floor and the remaining two floors you have to use the stairs, but no problem we are in holiday and you have always to think positive and not to let small thing ruin your family vacation. - The second morning and after having our organic breakfast which is in all the means not sufficient and has no verity specially for the little ones, I sat with front office manager and after thanking me for my understanding, I explained to him that we spent a horrible night and I will not allow it to happened again, he kept promising me that this AC thing will be fixed by afternoon. - I told him that today is my wedding anniversary and I heard about â€œAl Jamal restaurantâ€� as a very decent restaurant and requested him to help me doing a booking for me and my wife and he did thankfully. - I went with my family for a tour to the Aya Sofya, Sultan Ahmet mosque and Topkapi Sarayi and after my kids had their dinner we went to hotel around 8:00 pm to change and to go with my wife to celebrate our anniversary, when we reached the hotel I asked for the front office manager and I have been told by bell boy that he went home and he is sorry to tell me that the maintenance people didnâ€™t show up and the AC didnâ€™t fixed but he promised that will be fix by tomorrow !!! - You can imagine my feeling and my reaction, I started to lose my temper and threating to call the police in the face of the poor bill boy (who hardly speak English), the bell boy after he was refusing to call his boss and when he heard the word police he grape his mobile and call the boss who was excusing that it is the maintenance companyâ€™s problem not his and it will solve by tomorrow, I made myself clear that Iâ€™m not going to put my family for another night of misery and threating to call to police unless to be paid back for the remaining four nights, the Boss finally agreed and gave his instruction to the bill boy to write me a debit note for the refund of the four nights to be paid to me on Monday because they donâ€™t have money at the hotel and the bank closed for Saturday and Sunday. - It is 9:30 pm now I found myself and my family with no accommodation in busy city like Istanbul at the busiest time of year, I told my wife and kids to pack our stuff until I find another hotel, it took me more than 3 hours and checking 25 hotels all of them fully booked, have one room or only for a night or two. Finally and through one of the travel agent I found two rooms at â€œCentral Palace Hotelâ€� which was a way way better comparing to the â€œFive Boutique Hotelâ€� I went back to the hotel, took my family and the luggage, of course I didnâ€™t get any help from any one to get the luggage down through the stairs and the tiny elevator, everybody was looking at me as a bad news and glade to get rid of me. - I checked at the Central Palace Hotel around 1:00 am, I was tired, frustrated and angry from the worst three hours . - Thank you â€œFive Boutique Hotelâ€� for ruin my anniversary, for ruin two days of my 5 daysâ€™ vacation and most of all for the tension I found myself in looking for a hotel at the middle of the night. - I went on Monday and I found my money with the reception with no word of apology or any kind of compensation above of that the reception before giving me the money he requested to sign a disclaimer that I will not decline the payment paid by the credit card and not request any financial damage (which I did) but Iâ€™m writing this review for anyone who is planning to stay there to think again !!! it doesnâ€™t worth it !!!!! After telling my personal experience, letâ€™s critique and evaluate the hotel in logical way: - Location: the hotel The hotel located on a side street, the street has a very sharp slop, so you have to watch out if you have kids with stroller, the hotel is 10-15 minutes walking to Taxim square and Istiktal Street. - The rooms: the rooms I booked was in the 7th floor, one is convenient in size, but the second one was an attic kind of room, Iâ€™m 170 cm in tall I can walk only o the middle of the room then I have to bend. - The breakfast: The breakfast was limited and no much choice specially for kids, coffee and tea taste horrible. - Cleanness: I can say it was OK. - Value of money: overrated, overpriced hotel because of the mambo jumbo of the â€œOrganic Designationâ€� - Is the Hotel is Four star ???? absolutely not a Two or maybe Three star. - Last advice: there are many hotels in the area with better location closer to Taxim Square, Istiktal Street and the Metro station, with much better amenities and services with the same range of rate.

Reviews.Title: “comme ci comme Ã§a”
Reviews.Author: EmreC
Reviews.Content: At least it was clean. The hotel room was so simple for the but it was clean, breakfast was not perfect but also not bad. I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place and attractive”
Reviews.Author: Dinaalkashef
Reviews.Content: Well everything was wonderful at the Hotel: 1st the Manager and the staff are amazing and they would explain in brief details the Excursions in Istanbul. They would make sure that you are fine and satisfied with the services. 2nd We didn't expect our room to be beautiful, big and clean...it was more than above our expectation. You would like to stay one complete night in the room to enjoy the place. 3rd the Breakfast was so delicious and the tea is irresistible. it would let you go back again to Istanbul. Overall the location is good away from any noise so you could sleep and close to the shopping areas and markets, you would ask the Manager for any location he would help you/ organise for you a Taxi if required. I would recommend the hotel for everyone. it is sufficient enough to feel safe at the place

Reviews.Title: “Pleaseant stay in friendly environement”
Reviews.Author: MerkurDA
Reviews.Content: The service starts with a free ride from the airport to the hotel. My plane was one hour late, so I missed my pick-up service but after a call at the hotel they sent me another driver to get there. I stayed there four nights in a small room with everything available and necessary for a pleasant stay. WLAN was accessible for free, the bathroom and sanitary equipment was almost new, the other furnitures were well suited and functional. The bed was slightly too hard for my understanding but was fine for the stay. The room was equipped with a air-condition system which was installed just over the bed creating a constand flow of very cold air. In the end it was more convenient to open the window to a small backyard without significant noises and use this "natural" cooling at night. The breakfast showed more choices than ever needed, ranging from vegetables in oil over typical Turkish cakes to a selection of dried fruits, cheeses of different kinds, to some more international cereals. The staff was kind and cooperative. The hotel itself is located ~30min travel by public transport from the central places around the palace and mosques away, but close and nearby the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cOmenius_11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the above hotel with 12 colleagues. We had a wonderful time. The hotel was clean and the food was excellent. There was a large variety of organic food for breakfast.. the staff were friendly and only too willing to offer help when asked. The rooms were clean and quiet. A welcome plis after a very busy day.I recommend this hotel especially if you are like me and enjoy organic food but even if you don't then this is a hotel you must try at while in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent green hotel, support it!”
Reviews.Author: 57090Suzanne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the height of the tourist season. The hotel staff sent someone to the airport to pick us up. The hotel is not in Sultanahmet, where tourists are packed together in a small area. Five Boutique is not located in a tourist area, so it has the feeling of an authentic neighborhood, yet is still centrally located. Takism is a 15 minute walk. The room was on the top floor, and was clean, spacious and new! The beds were perfect. I was traveling with my neice and husband, so we had a family room. The staff was accommodating and lovely! Breakfast was excellent! The hotel is small, clean, and doesn't have the feeling of thousands of tourists having slept in the beds, and hard use. It was quiet, quiet, quiet, and great to come back to after a full day of touring. Taxis are easy to get from the street directly in front of the hotel. I recommend this rather than public transportation, which actually costs more, and takes longer to get to the tourist areas. Stay there and support Istanbul's first green, organic hotel, Turkish style!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 4 stars or boutique status”
Reviews.Author: Phunky_Monkey
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel on the strength of previous reviews, location and the cost and feel that in general it is not a terrible place to stay however, Iâ€™m not entirely certain how a Turkish hotel acquires itâ€™s star rating but feel this place was generously given a four star rating. Although Iâ€™ve not written reviews before, Iâ€™ve had a fair amount of experience of varying hotels and levels of service. My first night was in a small room and I was told that I would be moved to a larger room for the subsequent nights of my stay. Whilst out the next day, without my notification, my possessions & valuables were moved to the alternative room, which I felt was a little too forward of the hotel. One night my girlfriend stayed with me at the hotel and to my surprise I was informed that a charge of â‚¬30 would be incurred for this â€“ I feel this was a product of the hotelâ€™s greed and was not in character of a personalised service fitting a boutique hotel or any other hotel for that matter. The second time my girlfriend stayed with me at the hotel, we spoke to the night manager and he assured us that the fee for having a guest stay the night would be waved however this was not to be, which left me with a sense of distrust towards the staff. On my last day, a porter knocked on the door and I asked his business, he said heâ€™d come to check the mini bar before I check out. As I was not descent I asked him to come back later yet he still proceeded to open my door with his key, this was to be repeated a second time which was I feel is quite a very basic courtesy and an infringement on privacy. Also, I discovered that the taxi rank the hotel use for their guests pay for the hotels custom, so I feel that guests would a better deal if they were to find their own taxi rather than request one via the hotel. The hotelâ€™s only lift smells of sewage which judging by other reviews seems to be the case for some time now. One final point Iâ€™d like to make, Mr Yilmaz Cetin was the General Manager during my stay and during checking out, I mentioned that Iâ€™ll be writing a review of my experience to which he responded with the statement, â€œfor each bad review the hotel receives, I assure you we will receive 10 very good reviewsâ€�, read whatever you will into that. My experience of boutique hotels to date have been very satisfying and I prefer the intimacy of boutique hotels to larger corporate hotels. In general my stay was not a terrible one, however, Five Boutique Hotel I feel did not offer the kind of bespoke level of service I would expect of boutique hotels and are certainly not fitting of a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in the hearth of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ugurdy
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is amazing! you can walk almost anywhere near her or transportation to the Old Istanbul such as Sultanahmet, Palaces etc. As you can see in its name, it is a boutique hotel and surprisingly unique complex in Turkey as Organic Hotel! You can feel this atmosphere everywhere in the hotel. Staff is excellent, very warm, friendly. Everything you can think about "Green" is here! Even the texture, sheets, paints, products are green! Open buffet breakfast is delicious and deserved all my pennies I spent for here. Ohhh by the way, breakfast is included in the price-:). Rooms are clean, large, stylish and very comfortable. I really slept very well in this bed I can say. By the way, they picked us free from the airport since we book the room via their website and the prices are very affordable when you compare all the service you will get and most important environment friendly! I recommend you all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Attentive Staff, Comfy rooms, Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: NoodL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Five Boutique Hotel for 6 nights in December with my husband. I have Turkish parents and have been to Turkey quite a bit, yet this was the first time with my husband so we opted to stay in a hotel rather than with family. Having been to Istanbul many times, I am quite familiar with localities of the tourist attractions and where the "it" place to be is. Hence why I chose this hotel. We were swinging between the Ramada which is up the road, and Five Boutique but what appealed to me about Five B, is the price and that it is independantly owned. I have found in the past, independantly owned hotels are far more hospitable than those of a large chain. I was spot on with this hotel! The receptionists greeted us with smiles at our arrival which was past 11pm and helped us up to our room, and never failed to greet us as we saw them each morning/night as we left/returned to the hotel. The Standard room was large enough to move about comfortably and the bathroom was modern and clean. The room is equipped with a split system heater/airconditioner which worked with ease. The hotel also has free wifi which is a bonus. We opted not to have breakfast at the hotel as I wanted to show my husband how Turks do it the traditional way and we ate outside. In terms of location, it's close to public transport and short work from Taksim Square which is a must to visit - heaps of retail and cafe/restaurants. The only doubt I had was regarding the hotel was the negative comments on Trip Advisor about the smell in the lift. I don't fully agree with the harsh comments as the smell was not so bad that it was intolerable. The lift also has a automatic air freshener which releases perfume periodically which obviously was put in place because of complaints. We spoke to the manager just to get some insight as to why this happens and he explained that as it is such an old building the sewage system is under the building. To fix the problem would mean that they would have to demolish the whole hotel and reinstall the sewage and rebuild. Seriously, people need to get over it, it's not like you are sleeping in the elevator. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: lindacarolina
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for two reasons: the price (one of the lowest in this expensive area in Istanbul) and the fact that it is an "organic" hotel. The room and the bathroom were very spacious, well furnished and clean. The mattress was very comfortable, but the room was a bit noisy (nothing terrible - couldn't tell if it was from traffic or from heating systems outside the window). I particularly liked breakfast: a large variety of organic food, served in a lovely veranda. You certainly get more than what you pay for, compared to other accomodations in the NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ± area.

Reviews.Title: “interesting trip in december”
Reviews.Author: austria_11
Reviews.Content: we were very satisfied and loved the trip to this exciting and wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Its organic alright - hotel smells real BAD!”
Reviews.Author: LouisaSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days at Five Boutique "Organic"hotel. It was not great. The first room was so small we couldnt swing a cat in it. They then sent us to the 7th floor attic type room my husband being 1.8m tall couldnt stand upright on the left side of the room. The lift only goes to the 5th floor but it smells so bad you dont actually want to use it. Our bathroom had an outlet pipe that smelt the same which we covered up with packaging tape to get rid of the smell. No bath or basin plug in the entire hotel after 2 hours they find one. Breakfasts were horrible - Bed linen was dirty - no thanks not my choice! Restaurant menu in room is 5 years old prices do not apply.

Reviews.Title: “it has everything what one needs”
Reviews.Author: byarat
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s really good location and very clean. The staff is very friendly, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality and Location”
Reviews.Author: dublin62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and the staff are very helpful and friendly. Mohammed is especially great, he is available to help at all times. The rooms are good, have everything you need without being especially luxurious. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: suzziewoozie
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. This is definitely NOT a four star hotel. The sheets were not clean with someones blood stains, the bathroom had hair on the floor. The breakfast, supposedly "organic" was meager, minimalistic and not so fresh. The list had a terrible smell and security was questionable. Location was a 1km walk from the main city square. Try somewhere else there are plenty of places in Istanbul better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Functional and good value”
Reviews.Author: Danmat2
Reviews.Content: Booked as very close to the conference I was attending at the military museum. This was only 200m away. Quite a way from the old town - one hour brisk walk or taxi (traffic is usually pretty bad) or public transport if you can work it out. Quiet spot. Spacious clean family room on fifth flour. Breakfast a bit underwhelming after all the organic hype - but adequate. Constant unfortunate smell of sewage in the lift but not elsewhere. Staff polite and helpful although for some reason would not initially give us two room keys! All in all did the job well enough especially in view of the rate of 60 euros each B+B.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good price, but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few nights in May '10 while visiting some friends in IST. First, it is a very small and (looks like) family-driven hotel. It is probably an old apartment building that has been refitted like a hotel not long ago. That's OK, gives some caracther. PROS: - The hotel seems new, so that's good. Very clean and proper. - Small size, it is different from the typical big Western chain. - Staff is corteous (though English is quite bad, but that's Turkey and nobody speaks anything but Turkish). So it is OK. - Location is very convenient. If you have never been to IST: Sulaimaniye is the old-town where most touristic stuff is, but at evening-night is DEAD. So better stay in the North shore (Istanbul is huge btw). Taksim is Istanbul's Times Square, so you better stay there. There are many hotels in Istiktal Street (next to Taksim) BUT the area is unbelievably noisy and crowded 24/7. The hotel is 10 minutes-walk from there, in a tiny street perpendicular to a big boulevard (next to Hilton) in a nice & good residential area. - Price was good for location/quality. MINUS: - This is not a 4-star hotel. Let's say 2 or 3. - Breakfast is anything but organics, but it is just a typical breakfast (not that bad, but why place the organic?). - The hotel is new so everything works OK. But u can see that the finishes in the room are not the best, so I feel in a few years it will be not the best place to be. - Room is OK but pretty uninspiring. I would recommend it based on the relation price/location/quality and the fact that whilst it is very very central and well-located, it is also in a very quiet area so you can feel more like living in Istanbul and not only visiting (and sleep well at night with no noise from the busy Istanbul streets and avenues).

Reviews.Title: “simple hotel; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cairo_traveler
Reviews.Content: you really have everything you need in this small, cozy hotel which is superbly located. walking distance from Taksim and walking distance from Osmanbey Metro station and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, not so organic, needs to be more hygienic, food is terrible, staff very nosy”
Reviews.Author: sk124
Reviews.Content: Long review, but worth reading before considering this place... Stayed here for 4 nights. First impression and first night was okay, it felt clean, staff was friendly, but by the 2nd night, you start to realize a little bit more about the place. The hotel always smelled like a public washroom, especially the elevator and hallways. The bathrooms, even in the superior (best room in the hotel) were terrible, mould in the corner of showers, and rooms are not consistent. You can pay 54 euros for a single room and that's more than enough, I would recommend you NOT to pay the 100+ euros for the superior or deluxe since it is essentially the same thing. I stayed in all three types of rooms, the single deluxe and superior and found some rooms has things others didn't no consistency. Like a simple thing like a reading lamp was available in the single, but not in a superior. Did they run out of furniture? Even general maintenance is lacking, light bulbs need to be replaced, air conditioner is loud and noisy (good luck sleeping with that on). As for cleanliness, bedsheets always had the "slept in" already feel to them, which is terrible when they should be crisp and smell fresh upon first use. I can still smell this hotel days later, just thinking about that place irritates me. It is a decent place for one night since it is very modern and not a hole in the wall, but if they clean it better it could be so much more. Organic breakfast was charming the first day, but then got tiring and just unappealing. Same things wrapped and reused the next day, stale breads, and let me mention the FLIES all over the tomatoes, cucumbers, and cheeses.. we skipped this free breakfast and found better options outside worth paying for.. even the tea is terrible, coffee was diluted.. couldnt get a decent hot drink in this place... Organic shampoos and soaps a nice addition, they are trying hard I give them credit but they are luring you in with the false pretense that it's all organic. I know this because I saw a staff member filling "organic shampoo bottles" with some other soap... nice try buddy.. As for staff, they are all very helpuful, but extremely nosy and intrusive. They ask too many questions, and this doesn't pass for curiosity it's downright pathetic. I came back to my room late one night with my wife around 1am, and she went upstairs first, one of the hotel staff approached me and said it costs extra to have "guests". On top of that the room KEYS NEVER WORKED the entire stay so every time you want to enter your room, a hotel staff has to take you up now at 1am in the morning and i'm tipsy with my wife, we just want to get into our room privately. This hotel is very concerned about being payed right away, two times a day they come into the room to check the minibar, which is irritating when I'm with my wife getting down to business.. or trying to. I wouldn't stay here ever again, thought we would try a little boutique hotel but next time it's the Hilton across the street.. Used to be a hidden gem, not anymore.Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: rotco
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for a week and we were very pleased with its services (helpful staff, tasty breakfast, clean room). The hotel has a good location, 10 min. walking from Taksim Square, in a less noisy area. The rooms are small but clean; they change the towels daily if you want. The rooms have air-conditioning, satellite TV, hair dryer. The breakfast is very good with a selection of fine cheese, honey, jam etc. You have access to free Wi-Fi in the hotel premises and it is perfectly working. The staff is great, very helpful and polite. It is a nice hotel with good services and we will certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Azadeh5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at this fantastic hotel, and we are impressed by their friendly manner, politeness and flexibility of all the staff and management. The hotel is located in short distance, around 10 minutes walk from Taksim Square, and the famous Istiklal Street, the best place where you can see the great night life of Istanbul. Close to restaurants and shopping centers. Due to our schedule, we had a gap during our stay, and we tried 3 different rooms, and each room was kind of different with others in terms of bathroom and space. All rooms are very clean, and although one of them was a little small to comfortably fit two persons, all rooms are nicely decorated and lovely. There are also tea and coffee facilities in all rooms, and a safe box. Nice bathroom and several organic kits, including dental, swing, shaving, etc are available. There is plenty of closet space. Donâ€™t forget that the hotel offers a one way free transportation to Atatork airport if you stay there 3 nights. We stayed there 7 nights, but as we had to go to the other airport (Sabiha Gocken) they offered us one way transportation, and they managed it well. The environmental friendly nature of products and organic breakfast was an important advantage. The breakfast is fine and organic, although after one week stay, there was no change and it was no more exciting. The hotel has totally 19 rooms. My friend also has stayed here and was happy for the high speed free internet, but you must have your notebook and there is no public post or lap-top. We selected this hotel because all other reviews highlighted the good service and the helpful staff and it was very much true. I strongly recommend this hotel to be chosen for your stay in Istanbul. We wish to thank the staff for making our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel/perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: Egypt-Istanbul-lover
Reviews.Content: Unhesitatingly, I recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a good hotel with reasonable rates. The nice staff in this hotel are very helpful and do their best for the customer's comfort. The service, cleanliness and rooms are excellent. The location is about 10-15 minutes walking from Taksim Square. and it is close the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! I definitely advice this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oskoui
Reviews.Content: 2 first things I paid attention in this hotel: 1. Perfect staffs ( I would like to say thank you to all warm staffs and my warm regards to all of them; Specially Mr. Taha and Mr. Umot, they patiently answer all our questions and help us to discover the good places of the city) 2. Organic culture ( it is valuable to find in this world, respecting to the nature, the major services of this hotel was based on organic culture) The room was very clean and the room service was very good, it was situated in good place and just 15 minute by walk until Taksim square. The perfect free WI-FI internet was another advantage! Although the room was small but was really clean. The only problem that make me really angry was the internal telephone price, inside my room I called the other hotel inside Istanbul, and I totally talked less than 5 min but I paid 30$ as a telephone cost!!! So be careful about the other cost! I'll definitely stay there again in my next trips to the Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The amazing and helpful staff make this hotel what it is”
Reviews.Author: travellingspissy
Reviews.Content: After searching for a nice and reasonable hotel in the modern part of Istanbul, we were very happy to find the Five Boutique Hotel. Reading reviews here on TripAdvisor we felt confident that we had made the right choice - and we were not disappointed. The hotel is small and cozy. We had one of their smaller rooms, and it was just what we needed. The rooms are clean and modern and very quiet at night. Air-conditioning worked perfectly - which is important in Istanbul in the middle of July. The breakfast is nice, our only complaint would be that it was sometimes a hard push to get up before it finishes at 10am. Free wifi in the whole hotel is also a great benefit! But what makes this hotel a true gem is the service provided by the staff. From the moment we arrived, until the moment we left, they gave us very personal and professional service. They were always on hand with friendly advice and help with getting around Istanbul. We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sacher10
Reviews.Content: Firstly i would like to say huge thank you to all lovely staff in Five Boutique hotel. I had a great time. Everthing was perfect. I should say that, this was the best hotel i have ever stayed in.Without no doubt i will definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “go go go! fabolous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redbull187309
Reviews.Content: I must say ,this hotel is absolutely fantastic. If you want to enjoy your holiday, you should go there. The staff is so helpful. I would like to thank all of them for helping me and make my vacation perfect while I was there. I will definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great service and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: lovegreatplaces
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for 3 weeks (including a couple of side trips around Turkey) and stayed at Five Boutique Hotel. I was there for a conference and a workshop so my main criteria were that my accommodation was close to Nisantasi, safe for a single woman, wireless internet and that I could get a good night's sleep. Five Hotel was excellent in all of these. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was immaculate (cleaned daily) and the small restaurant served basic but well priced food (lots of different salad choices - great for Vegetarians. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk north of Taksim (and therefore the funicular and tram to Sultanahmet), but far away enough to not suffer any noise pollution!! I'll definitely stay there again if I'm fortunate enough to get back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed 4 nights from 30 june...”
Reviews.Author: eycwh04
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 4 nights from 30 june, 2010. My room was superior room which was very spaious. All the staff was very helpful and kind. The organic complementary breakfast was very unique. Location was excellent for me because I had some meeting in military museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great services”
Reviews.Author: anitaanita
Reviews.Content: Loved it, would definitely use it as my base in Istanbul, no matter for business trips or personal trips. For a very cheap person like me, it is probably the best bargain there is in Istanbul, which does not compromise services, really good.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel to a good price”
Reviews.Author: ultramarin120972
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to a good price with gentle personal. Clean room, free internet (WLAN), functioning air conditioning, organic products

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get, but hotel prices in Istanbul aren't cheap during peak season”
Reviews.Author: WLM_10
Reviews.Content: My holiday to Instanbul was a quick 2 and a half day visit. Hotel isn't all that central, a 15-20 minute walk to Taksim Square unless you want to pay about 1.5lira for the bus, and if you take the metro, funicular, and tram to the Sultanahmet area where most of the tourist sights are, your total journey would take around 70 minutes. Shame we only realised on our last day that there you can catch a bus from the bus stop at the top of the street and that takes you all the way to Eminonu which is at the edge of the Sultanahmet area. The ride at off peak only took 10 minutes, and cost about 1.50lira. My first impressions was not good dealing with them before we checked-in. We were supposed to have a complimentary airport transfer which failed to show. We were met by a lady there after having to call the hotel to check what was happening after we could not spot anyone from the hotel. She mentioned that because we arrived on a very busy Friday afternoon, the hotel transfer bus is stuck in traffic and and it would be quicker to get a taxi there. She assured me the hotel would pay for this. When we arrived at the hotel, the person at the front reception was ignorant and wanted me to pay for the taxi fare which I flatly refused and reminded him that I was told the hotel would take care of it. He didn't argue with me and did pay the taxi driver. The room was small, but adequate. Very clean. They did not provide bath robes as advertised. The safe was not bolted onto the cupboard so despite being present, someone could have easily picked it up and walked off with it! There is free Wi-Fi, and the staff were very attentive and courteous throughout our stay. Breakfast was simple, but a fair amount of choice and variety.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel located in very nice area of Taxim, but is really quiet at the same time”
Reviews.Author: Jenya1986
Reviews.Content: Good service, very friendly but do not speak very good English which is not big obstacle. Very flexible in check-ins and check-outs (about time) I had a single room (economy) but is very good. The only thing that towels and bedding have not been changed every day. Location is perfect, very close to the bus coach station from which the buses go to the airports, very close to the main street. At the same time it was a quiet street. The best - the location, wireless internet is for free, friendly service and good breakfast The least - cleaning up very late afternoon...

Reviews.Title: “Enthusiastic recommendation. I'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated, clean room and bath, everything neat and functioning. Warm helpful staff with good follow-through. Good breakfast. I liked being near Taksim rather than in Sultan-Ahmet. I can recommend the Five Boutique enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: patricksutter
Reviews.Content: It was just wonderful to stay in such a well located hotel.The service and rooms were great,very close to the nightlife and shopping centers.Beside all of that the food was great.I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and appreciate all the staff for a well organised profession.Hope to come again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: marilyn1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days with my family here,the hotel was situated in a fantastic location of Istanbul,where most of the tourist location can be reached by foot.Its is a family run hotel with very kind and helpful staff who are always ready to assit you with all your needs.SO IF YOU ARE GOING TO iSTANBUL PLS GIVE A TOUGHT TO Five Boutique Hotel for your memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with lovely staff with respect for nature”
Reviews.Author: deoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pleasent, the staff was very nice and kind and the rooms vere very comfortable. We got what we payed! Absolutly. We prefered to stay here also because of it's an organic hotel. They serve organic food with so good taste and also the towels and soaps were organic etc. It's kind of very cool but mostly nice that the environment and health is a priority at the hotel. The hotel is close to Taksim squere as well as to Nisantasi-a more exclusive shopping area. Since busses and metro is close to the hotel, it was very easy to reach most places of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ioanna_10
Reviews.Content: Really very pleasant place to stay! New hotel with good quality interior and comfortable rooms. But the brilliant of current place is staff! I have traveled a lot, but those people surprise me very much. If you want personal attention and pleasant time, chose this place! Ioanna Kazahkstan

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy_b_10
Reviews.Content: Through my experiences, this is one of the best hotels in Istanbul. The staff was so friendly that I had ever met any problems. The cleanliness, the service and the sleep quality were each perfect during my stay. It is also located in a very popular place of the city so you can arrive wherever you want in such a short time. I really thank the all hotel staff and my friend who recommended this hotel to me. I certainly recommend Five Boutique Hotel if you visit Istanbul once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “A small stylish hotel offering excellent value”
Reviews.Author: madrita
Reviews.Content: The prices in Istanbul have shot up in the last few years so it was great to find a good value hotel within easy walking distance of Taksim. Five is a real find. The rooms are contemporary and comfortable, breakfast is interesting and well-presented and the staff are fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble - thank you to Muhsin, Ilker and Kamil. The lack of hot water one morning was irritating but otherwise we found everything else very good. Highly recommended for a great value, comfortable hotel with outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very friendly staff, lovely free breakfast, spacious room, free internet, convenient location near Taksim Square, affordable Cons: Twice during our stay we ran out of hot water and had to endure a cold shower :( Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay. It's not a fancy hotel, but is very clean with modern features.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: infinitejns
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Cute rooms, nice lobby, good internet service, etc.. The staff was spectacular. WE do not speak Turkish and not everyone in Turkey speaks English (less so than many countries). The staff made sure we got around with no problems. They made reservations, spoke to cabs on our behalf, made sure we were not ripped off, etc.. We also have strict dietary restrictions - so their restaurant cooked to our needs. We travel a lot and we consider this little find a jewel. Please keep in mind this is not the ritz. It is a nice, clean, comfortable hotel with great service at a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Find”
Reviews.Author: mahogany76
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews and I was not disappointed. I had lived in Istanbul before and was coming for spring break and this hotel was the perfect choice. A great location, close to all choices of transportation and an easy walk to Taksim and Nisantasi; without having to deal with the noise. The hotel was very clean and I felt safe the whole time. The breakfast offered was delicious Turkish style and the eating area was nice. My room was cozy and always clean. I really enjoyed the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to my friends and I would definitely come again. Thanks to Mr. Kamil, Mr. Muhsin, Mr. Ilker and the rest of the staff, who were friendly, charming and always ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: gracesams
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Five Boutique Hotel just 2 weeks ago. I love it :) It is very well decorated. The staff is very helpful and professional. If I go to Turkey again, this hotel will be my first option. Grace

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Kungfucharlie
Reviews.Content: It was my first business trip to Istanbul and came with the usual trepidation about doing business in another country. It was very nice to know at the end of each day that returning to the hotel you would be greeted with a smile and would you like some tea. The staff in this hotel are excellent the rooms clean, the breakfast excellent (with the exception of a slightly musty smell in the bathroom of my room, something my colleague did however not endure in his room, I have absolutely no complaints) If you are tall avoid the top floor rooms as they are in the eaves so have partially restricted head room. All in all an excellent hotel within walking distance of Taksim Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City, Wonderful Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Marrien
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul and everything we've seen, everything we've tasted and everywhere we were, was sooo special. Furthermore, this hotel was the most enjoyable part of our trip. Unfortunately, we had just a limited time for Istanbul but are going to visit Istanbul and this lovely Five Boutique Hotel again. The people were very positive and helpful, I can say that the rooms were very clean too. We were mostly outdoors but in that time we were in the hotel we enjoyed it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: Heidi3
Reviews.Content: We had such a great stay at Five Boutique. The rooms were so clean and modern, the staff friendly and helpful, and in such a central location. I can't wait to go back to this hotel again. The new concept is very forward thinking. Thanks for makingn our trip to Istanbul so wonderful. RR Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: valeriyaa
Reviews.Content: Last month we stayed in this hotel. We were there on business trip. we liked it so much, it is so cozy, so comfotable, the service staff is so well-wishing and friendly. If you have any little problem you will be paid a lot of attention. Also as for me cleaness,food and comfort are very important. All these 3 points were great. Especially the food in this hotel,amazing choice especially for people who take care about healthy meals. This hotel is located very close to the centre, so after work we had even a chance to walk in the heart of this amazing city and enjoy it. Thanks a lot to staff for a great work. Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel, great concept at a price”
Reviews.Author: laytnlaus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at 5 Boutique Hotel. The room was large and very clean. Catered to all our needs. The staff were very friendly and helpful however we felt we were the only people staying in the hotel at that time and feel that it was a little expensive, probably could have stayed at one of the larger good chains for the same price. If you like small boutique hotels this would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Greatfull”
Reviews.Author: Jeko83
Reviews.Content: I could only say it was wanderfull..it was the 6Â° times i came in turkey and i always love it.... A special thanks to Ilker... I hope to come here this year...

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it if you don't want to stay in the red light district”
Reviews.Author: traveler1235
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I am writing this review to help out people who really want to have a good experience in Istanbul. I am originally from Turkey, and I know Istanbul fairly well, and I made the mistake to read the reviews on this website and booked a room in this hotel. We booked this hotel with a large group of friends (inluding some family and bf) for the close proximity to Taksim and the metro. I wanted to make sure that I could show people a good time, since it was their first trip to Turkey. Boy what a disappointment. First of all, the hotel is located in the Red Light District of Istanbul. So expect to see lots of travestis after midnight in the area (if you decide to walk to the hotel). Second, the hotel management is comfortable admitting people with Russian hookers overnight (we actually ran into some when we were checking out, and boy it was a scene). Lastly, the hotel decided to charge us 30 euros for the hotel shuttle, which is absolutely ridiculous, and the only reason we accepted it was because he assured us that this would be the best service we get. However, the hotel shuttle ended up being super late and we almost missed the flight. Turns up the concierge is friends with the shuttle driver and that's why he was trying to rip us off, and he didn't even offer us to pay back the 65 liras we gave him after the shuttle being so late. Not only that, the shuttle driver YELLED at us, because we were demanding for some of our money back. SO UNPROFESSIONAL. If you really want to save money, seriously get a cab (which will cost you around 40 liras), or take the Havas Shuttle which is 10 liras per person in front of Taksim Square (they're super professional). Lastly, if you are looking for a great experience, try The Marmara Pera. Can't beat the location, and if you book it through tripadvisor or another website like that, you can get the same deal, but a much better/professional experience. I hope this review helps you all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place and very confortable”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKisses
Reviews.Content: I booked Five Boutique Hotel by chance, all the other big hotels were busy. I found myself in this cosy and confortable unique hotel and was immediately satisfied of my choice. Prices are very competitive compared to big hotels, service is very kind and familiar, very welcoming and friendly. Rooms are peculiar and confortable. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: HM99
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 of us (including children stayed at this hotel for a long weekend ... after a 10 days in south west Turkey. We all really enjoyed it. It is really nice touches, nice design and really friendly staff. Although rooms do vary, most are great. Harj We will be going back in 2010. Oh and Location location location!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: bilgego
Reviews.Content: We went to hotel as a group and they managed the group very well.(I was the group leader) We felt like our home.Hotel staff was like family member of us and they feel the needs and implemented immediately. Rooms were perfect. Location was very good and shops restaurants and museums were around. Hotel management quite professional and they educated the staff very well. I am hotelier for 20 years and I like this small hotel an will prefer this hotel whenever if I go to Istanbul.Thanks to all team and hotel Manager. Well Done! Bilge Gozukara

Reviews.Title: “no regret at all!”
Reviews.Author: JiniLeeds
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it was a bit disappointed with too small reception areas. But It recovered fully by very friendly staff, clean and comfortable room. So it feels worth it for the price definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Five Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCANDPC
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Istanbul and was just one night and two days, as I was going on to Bodrum. I liked the sound and ethos of Five Boutique Hotel and it lived up to expectations. The location is fairly convenient for Taksim Square, and quiet, since on a side street, the accommodation attractive and comfortable (though the dining area rather drab), and the staff exceptionally pleasant and helpful. My only negative experience of the city was being cheated by the taxi driver, who brought me from the airport to the hotel. He gave me change from my â‚¬50 in Turkish Lira. Beware! The notes and coins are similar in appearance to Euros and Cents, and it's easy for dishonest drivers to take advantage of distracted visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, Friendly Hotel in a Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithJess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Five Boutique Hotel for a period of 13 days and then for another 4 days following the completion of an organised tour. The hotel is situated in a trendy and upmarket location - Osmanbey where the metro station is a 10 minute walk and Nisantasi - a very chic and upmarket shopping and fine dining precinct is only a 5 minute walk. The area is very peaceful, but nevertheless you are able to arrive at all other destinations with ease. We managed to visit quite a few wonderful places all with the use of the Osmanbey Metro (Levent, Cihangir, Istinye Park, Kadikoy) just to name a few. Of course if you prefer to be in the madness and chaos of Beyoglu where Istiklal Street is, Five Boutique is an altogether different experience and much more pleasurable! The Hotel itself was only recently constructed and is quite tastefully furnished with quality furniture and room sizes being quite generous in proportion to other larger chain-type hotel rooms. Our room on the 2nd floor 212 was opulent in design with a bay window type terrace, floorboards throughout, airconditioning, quality light fittings and furnishings. A peaceful nights rest was always guaranteed despite the location of the window looking onto the street. The breakfast each morning comprised of organic type cereals, organic tomatoes/cucumbers, olives, cured meats, different type cheeses and wonderful homemade preserves which you could eat by the spoonful (sour cherry, strawberry, fig, rose petal and orange). Breads of a different variety with imbedded chese, olives, plain, wholemeal were plentiful and well as declicious savoury puffs or cakes with sultanas or cocoa. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to assist with any request. I requested the use of a laptop to secure airline seats for our return journey to Sydney and I was provided with a laptop and printer immediately and all with a smile. It would be true to say that Five Boutique is like staying in your home away from home, a unique family type atmosphere which you do not have when you stay in the larger chain type hotels. Thankyou to all at Five Boutique for an unforgettable and memorable experience. Special thanks must go to Umut (alias Elpitha), IIker from the Front Desk and Erhan (Managing Director). Regards and all the very best you all...I have no doubts you will be a resounding success!! - Cathy & Eleni.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in interesting location, more character than the standard big international chain”
Reviews.Author: ilcavaliereinglese
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in a room on the top floor with its own large balcony. We were attending a medical congress which was at the congress centre just five minutes' walk away, so the location was completely ideal for this. We had had a short holiday before the congress for which we'd stayed in one of the big American hotel chains down in the old city in a tiny upper floor room. Of the two experiences I much preferred this hotel, in that the service was friendly and much more personal and you didn't get the sense of endless tour parties coming in and out day after day like a conveyor belt,in contrast this was a more personalised exprience. I also felt very comfortable with the genuine warmth and honesty of the staff in all the advice and help they gave us. Of course travellers are all different and some may prefer the bland standardisation of the big hotel chains. If all you want is a holiday experience consisting of booking in to a massive hotel, eating three meals a day there amid the musicans and designer shops and going on some tours then stay in the old city. But if you want the freedom to come and go as you please from the base of a large and comfortable room with a great balcony, and the back-up of some friendly local staff as you explore Istanbul then I would choose this hotel every time. One last point, the hotel is quite well plced for public transport. You can get to Taksim by taking a bus from the main road about 1 minute from the hotel, it takes about 5 mins by bus or 15 mins to walk to Taksim, or 10 mins if you walk up to Osmanbey Metro station and get the subway 1 stop. From Taksim in addition to the subway you also have the new funicular to get down to the trams and Ferries at Kabatas (I'd highly recommend taking the ferry to Uskador on the Asian side for the raw atsmosphere of a non-touristy area). Taksim also has the historic tram to Galata. If you plan to get a taxi to the hotel, make sure you have the address AND map printed out in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for foreign tourists”
Reviews.Author: nanating
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a mom and pop feel, but tries too hard to be boutique. It is more for the business traveler, not tourists who want to be close to the historic sites. It is a far walk to the subway and old town. The room was decent sized, but they sprayed some really strong soapy perfume in the room that would not go away. It gave us a head ache. The service was fine, until we wanted to check out and the man at the desk would not remove a charge from our bill that said we used the mini bar. We did not take anything from the mini bar and were unnecessarily charged, but he insisted we must have eaten something and not remembered. Then he went on to say that he will have to pay it because he cannot remove it...not really sure what that was about, but the guilt trip was a big turn off. I do not suggest this place and think the organic theme is not legit. The breakfast was good, but really organic coco puffs? Not recommended to the foreign traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: MEAlbe
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located across from a convenience store, which is great if you need to buy any small items. It is also located about ten minutes by foot from Taksim Square and 10 minutes the other way to the Designer shopping district. Taxi fair to the Old city is about 15 Turkish Lira. The hotel is clean, new and serves a good breakfast. The staff are very friendly and contributed to the overall success of my trip. I would suggest this hotel to anyone staying in Istanbul for business or pleasure. A+

Reviews.Title: “a well kept secret, a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: pariscat77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really welle situated. No noise, no need to take a taxi to go to city center. A nice old apartment building have been restorated. The staff is very wellcoming and child friendly. Because of the age of the building, there was a slight moist smell in the elevator (The air was too hot and humid in Istanbul those days) but the decoration of the rooms was really successfull. We had everything that we needed in an optimal size of space, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was brand new. Everything in this hotel was organic (shampoos, soaps, breakfast) Nice adresse, a really great alternative to other bigger hotels in Taksim district with the quality - price balance. I will absolutly go there again for my next visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Five Boutique Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mongo2009
Reviews.Content: Hello, We spent 1 week at this hotel and everything went perfect. I found the overall service to be high and the breakfast was excellent. The location was fine also... we chose to walk the way into town and it took 10/15 minutes but by car it would obviously be quicker. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend a relaxing week in Istanbul. I'd like to give a special thanks to Ilker Karadag and his colleagues for their kindness and expertise. Thanks, Kevser Kaya

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: malSydney
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. It is very clean and quiet. The breakfast is good, and everything is organic. The staff are amazingly helpful. It is very close to the conference centre, and an excellent choice if you are attending a convention. I would highly recommend it this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Five is strictly ok.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugN
Reviews.Content: Five Boutique Hotel turned out to be different from all the reviews I read about it. It did not live upto expectations. Itâ€™s not a bad hotel-the room was great, but it definitely doesnâ€™t deserve to be voted #5 hotel in Istanbul (by Trip Advisor-this was the rating when I booked a room). The room was big and nice-very beautifully furnished with a big balcony and an adequate bathroom. Lovely organic toiletries, with many extras like a dental kit, vanity kit, sewing kit, etc. There was a safe in the room, and a TV but I missed having a hot-water kettle and a full-length mirror. The double lock in our room didnâ€™t work though, and another guest said that her A/C didnâ€™t work and neither did her safe. We didnâ€™t face any such problems. Some one complained about the elevator smelling in one review on Tripadvisor-the problem still exists but they have a little automated air freshener which helps. The free wi-fi was accessible in our room-up on the 5th floor, which was nice. Strangely enough they didnâ€™t have a public laptop nor a data cable for my husband whoâ€™s laptopâ€™s wifi facility was not working (but they did have ports in each room to use for the internet).The breakfast was awful-they keep talking about how everything is organic but I thought it all tasted bad! We were never asked for tea-we had to go up and ask the waiter for it. The hot part (eggs, sausages and egg-toast) of the breakfast was always ice cold-and we stayed here 3 days. The bread was not nice, and there was one fruit or none available in the buffet. My husband said that the jams were great as was the cereal but I had nothing to eat as all the rest was very bad. They were lazy about refreshing the buffet, and the waiter understood limited English. He also made us herbal tea (that was extra) without telling us it was not included in the buffet.The receptionist was helpful but always busy so it was hard to take any help. The rooms were clean but housekeeping didn't wash my used tea-cups all 3 days we were there.The location is not great at all-It's a long walk to Taksim-about 15 minutes. The location is safe enough but after a long day, it's tiring to walk 15 minutes to this place. The other metro is at Osmanbey which was again a 10-12 minute walk. Only Nisantasi is closer-about 7-10 minutes. 20 minutes to Istikal Caddessi (shopping and restaurant area). It is not close to any nightclubs, nor is it close to shopping or any historical sites. The only thing it's close to is all the Airline offices! One can catch an airport bus from Taksim Square but if you're more than 1 person, it's cheaper to get a taxi as the bus costs 17 TL/ person while the taxi costs about 38 TL.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Value”
Reviews.Author: Ekens
Reviews.Content: Eken family-Chicago We stayed at the Five Boutique Hotel for a week and had a wonderful time.Hotel is located on the side street, few buildings from from the Cumhuriyet Caddesi. The city center Taksim is within the walking distance or can be reached by bus. Bus stop is near by. Hotel is completely renovated, tastefully decorated and adorned by beautiful marble stairway. Our standard room was small, but ,light colored furniture made it bright and airy. It had plenty of closet space. Everything in the room was very clean and worked perfectly. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our great appreciation goes to them.Breakfast room was delightful. It had an atrium feeling to it. Turkish and continental style food was plentiful. Service was excellent. There is a subway station (Osmanbey) few blocks away. It takes you to a big Shopping "Mall-Metro City". Metro station is located conveniently in the Mall. There is an excellent food court , Migros Supermarket and lots of stores. Chic Nisantasi district with designer boutiques and cafes are 10 minute walk away.We also highly recommend our favorite fast food restaurant SARAY, with their authentic Turkish food , at bargain prices. We can not say enough good things about this lovely hotel, good price and the most pleasant and helpful staff. We wish to thank the staff for making our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel nice price but that's all”
Reviews.Author: miketeddymike
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel because the price was very good and specially because it was in the first place in Tripadvisor's ranking for Istanbul. It definitely doesn't deserve the fist place. The hotel is ok, new, clean, with a very special smell - probably some cleaning product, but not peasant at all. We booked a simple room witch is small. You should book a bigger one if you intend to stay more than 2 days. The good things are the free pick-up at the airport and the free wi-fi in the rooms. The service is friendly but that doesn't mean necessarily good. The neighborhood is very commercial. There is a subway station nearby who can be practical depending where you are going. For cultural sightseeing it is not the best address. Taxis aren't so easy to communicate with in Istanbul and there aren't nice restaurant nearby. I think it is a nice hotel to stay if you have to work nearby if it still new. Probably in some years it won't be nice...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: GabyC
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, large nice rooms and great breakfast! Very new and fresh hotel. Made it easy to arrive late due to the the free transfer from the airpor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business tavellers”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: Not necessarily the most convenient hotel for tourists, but we chose this hotel for business purposes - it is very close to the convention center and other parts of Istanbul's business district. I've stayed in some very scummy hotels here in the past, and this was a huge improvement. The price was excellent, and staying for three nights meant that we got a free transfer from the airport. The check-in was painless, and the staff friendly. The lift was tiny, but since I was only on the second floor, I didn't use it again as the stairs are very convenient. The hotel seems fairly new, but may start to look a bit worn quite quickly as the room furniture was all flatpack and some of it was already showing signs of wear. However, everything was very clean, and the bathroom was very pleasant with excellent plumbing and a nice shower enclosure. The organic toiletries were a nice touch and made it seem more personal than the big chain hotels. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the room was quiet at night. Aircon worked well, and wi-fi was free - excellent. Minibar was well stocked and had a nice range of organic juices as well as the usual coke and sprite. Breakfast was served downstairs and was plentiful and varied and very fresh. There was a small convenience store over the road, and bus-stops and taxis at the top of the street. Take a hotel business card with you though as the cab-drivers don't yet know where it is and they'll need the address. I'd consider staying here as a tourist - the price was a bargain, there are some nice restaurants in the vicinity, and it is a lot quieter than the madness near Seraglio Point.

Reviews.Title: “How disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Elix1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the positive comments on this website and decided to book for 4 nights. Once we came into the hotel, we were given a standard room while we payed for a deluxe room, but they didn't tell us until we found out asking at the porter. And before we saw the room they asked us, for the first time, to have the room payed for the entire stay. We complained and the room was changed into a deluxe room. The room was nice and spacious but dirty. The bathroom was kept in a bad manner with hair all over the shower and 2 towels on the floor hidden under the tub. We asked to have it cleaned and we found that they do not have an housekeeping service. The receptionist was doing the cleaning of the rooms. Also they do not change towels and sheets; even if you ask to have it changed by putting them on the floor. The breakfast is ok. The hotel position is nice but itâ€™s far away from everything in Istanbul. The closest place is Taksim Square at 20 min walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The Five Boutique Hotel is a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: gmarieMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a seven-night trip to Istanbul, where we stayed at the Five Boutique Hotel. The complimentary airport pick-up service was a stress-free way to begin our vacation. The staff at the hotel greeted us kindly upon arrival, and continued to be kind and helpful during our stay. The room itself was roomy, and included a balcony (no view) where my husband could smoke. The room was remarkably quiet -- we heard no noise from other rooms or from the street. The bed was very comfortable, the linens and bath towels were terrific, the air conditioning responsive. The hotel offered in-room wi-fi, which we used. Each morning we had a fabulous breakfast -- cheese and olives, vegetables, hard-boiled eggs, bread (with a toaster available), many interesting preserves and jams (fig, rose, strawberry, etc.), cereals, dried fruits, juice, yogurt -- that got me through the day. It was Ramadan, and I wasn't interested in eating publicly during the daytime out of respect for those who were fasting. Reading another reviewer's difficulty with keys, I can only report the opposite experience. When I returned later than my husband one night, and found that he (a sound sleeper) didn't answer the door when I knocked, I went to the front desk to ask that someone let me into the room. I was given a second key for the two nights that remained. I was asked to be sure to return it, so perhaps there has been difficulty with stolen keys in the past. I only know that I was accommodated. The location is about 10 blocks north of Taksim Square, a nice walk in the morning. If we didn't want to walk, we took buses that stop at the top of the street. We could get anywhere that we wanted to go from Taksim, either by bus, Metro or tram. What I liked best about the Five Boutique was the feeling that it was a home (except a lot cleaner than my own...). The staff felt like family (for a little while on the last two or three nights of our stay, I discussed English usage with one member of the staff, and got answers to questions I had about Turkish), and I was as comfortable as I am in my own home.

Reviews.Title: “Best convention hotel ...period.”
Reviews.Author: StevanMaine
Reviews.Content: Chosen for proximity to convention center, it did indeed turn out to be the absolurte closest. But then things got even better, the wonderful airy breakfast and breakfast room and best breakfast I've had in a number of countries added up. Then there was the fantastic staff who arranged a reception on no notice that was stunning. Staff were as attentive as at the Ritz where I have thought they provided the best in attention. Having a tour guide on the staff means they can take care of any request. Then if you stay for more than 3 days there is the free transfer to and from the airport which in Istanbul is wonderful as the driver can be implicitly trusted. Note that HIlton charges 80 Lira for the same transfer. Soundproofing was great, neighborhood quiet. Tiny convenience store across the street and great haircutter two shops up the street. And then you are as well exactly only 1 block from the Mehter band at the MIlitary museum up the street 1 block every day at 3 except 2 days a week. One negative review from "nnouhi" makes me think they were writing about the wrong hotel. I don't think they could have missed that great breafast room.

HotelInfo.Name: Five Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Taksim, Cumhuriyet Caddesi, Prof. Celal Oker Sok., No:5, Istanbul 34373, Turkey
